author: salmonelas123

text: This game really does not deserve any tracks on a list like this. Its OST is so generic and not worthy of the name Mario. The game itself is pretty decent, though - not as good as the WiiU version, but still solid multiplayer fun with the usual great level design.
author: BeleuchteteBrueder

text: @BeleuchteteBrueder The only thing I disliked about New Super Mario Bros. U was the final boss. It felt kinda anticlimactic to me. But other than that all the New Super Mario Bros. games are fantastic!
author: Moop Bread

text: @Moop Bread You think so? The first one on the DS had pretty bland levels, I thought. I liked the second one on the 3DS, though. And NSMBWii had the greatness of the multiplayer mode, but sound and levels were also not as top notch as in other Mario games. Only the WiiU title could really get me. Better levels and the great challenge mode. Only the music was still generic and boring, especially if compared to all the other great Mario games.
author: BeleuchteteBrueder

text: I've actually never played the DS version. (Well, I guess that technically isn't true because I borrowed it from my friend once several years ago. But I didn't play it very much.) I've heard its's really great too.

author: Pedro Gomez

text: Well I do not need to do that, no. And granted - the main theme is fairly decent. It is the only track I would consider putting on any video game music list. But to me it is nowhere near "iconic as hell". So it seems you like the OST, I don't. I am really dissapointed in it, because most Mario soundtracks are great. This one. Well it is "fucking" not.
